issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is not completely described.
resolution.name: Incomplete

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: No Empty Key restriction for Native Vector MapJoin added with HIVE-11394 is unnecessary.  It caused Llap orc_llap.q test to timeout on Hive QA because regular VectorMapJoinOperator is too slow.
fields.summary: Eliminate unnecessary MapJoin restriction in HIVE-11394

comments.body:
[~mmccline]: LGTM, +1 tests pending.

I don't think the following golden file change is a problem, but it would be good to clarify on this JIRA how the 3 turns into 25?

{code}
                         Group By Operator
                           aggregations: count(1)
                           Group By Vectorization:
-                              aggregators: VectorUDAFCount(ConstantVectorExpression(val 1) -> 3:long) -> bigint
+                              aggregators: VectorUDAFCount(ConstantVectorExpression(val 1) -> 25:long) -> bigint
{code}

Is that the column id # in lieu of a constant key like 0?

It is ok.  It has a Native Vector MapJoin parent.  Normally, regular Vector MapJoin creates a new output batch and so the column numbers are lower.  But the Native parent is taking the original input batch and adding scratch columns.  Thanks for noticing, but not a problem.

[~mmccline] - thankyou for working on the patch to fix the test.
The test used to run in less than 2 minutes, and ends up timing out after running for 40 minutes. Will the change mentioned here have that kind of impact?

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12833623/HIVE-14981.01.patch

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.
